00004 /*! \file pending_list.h
00005     \brief  Host Driver: Pending list for host instructions. 
00006 */
00007 
00008 #ifndef __PENDING_LIST_H__
00009 #define __PENDING_LIST_H__
00010 
00011 #include "octeon_instr.h"
00012 
00013 /** Status of an entry in the pending list.
00014  */
00015 typedef enum {
00016    OCTEON_PENDING_ENTRY_FREE=0,
00017    OCTEON_PENDING_ENTRY_USED,
00018    OCTEON_PENDING_ENTRY_TIMEOUT,
00019    OCTEON_PENDING_ENTRY_REMOVE
00020 }OCTEON_PENDING_ENTRY_STATUS;
00021 
00022 
00023 
00024 
00025 
00026 /** Structure of an entry in pending list.
00027  */
00028 typedef struct  {
00029 
00030   /** Used to add/delete this entry to one of the 3 response lists. */
00031    cavium_list_t                    list;
00032 
00033   /** Index in the input queue where this request was posted */
00034    uint16_t                         queue_index;
00035 
00036   /** Queue into which request was posted. */
00037    uint16_t                         iq_no;
00038 
00039   /** Index into pending_list that is returned to the user (for polling) */
00040    uint32_t                         request_id;
00041 
00042   /** Status of this entry */
00043    OCTEON_PENDING_ENTRY_STATUS      status;
00044 
00045   /** The instruction itself (not in the format that Octeon sees it)*/
00046    octeon_soft_instruction_t       *instr;
00047 
00048 }octeon_pending_entry_t;
00049 
00050 
00051 #define OCT_PENDING_ENTRY_SIZE  (sizeof(octeon_pending_entry_t))
00052 
00053 #define PEND_ENTRY_CALLBACK(pend_entry_ptr)                        \
00054            (pend_entry_ptr->instr->req_info.callback)
00055 
00056 #define PEND_ENTRY_CALLBACK_ARG(pend_entry_ptr)                    \
00057          (pend_entry_ptr->instr->req_info.callback_arg)
00058 
00059 
00060 
00061 
00062 /** Pending list implementation for each Octeon device. */
00063 
00064 typedef  struct  {
00065 
00066 
00067    /** Pending list for input instructions */
00068    octeon_pending_entry_t   *list;
00069 
00070    /** A list which indicates which entry in the pending_list above is free */
00071    uint32_t                 *free_list;
00072 
00073    /** The next location in pending_free_list where an index into pending_list
00074       can be saved */
00075    uint32_t                  free_index;
00076 
00077    /** Number of pending list entries. */
00078    uint32_t                  entries;
00079 
00080    /** Count of pending instructions */
00081    cavium_atomic_t           instr_count;
00082 
00083    /** A lock to control access to the pending list */
00084    cavium_spinlock_t         lock;
00085 
00086 
00087 } octeon_pending_list_t;
00088 
00089 
00090 
00091 
00092 
00093 /** Allocate and initialize a pending list for the number of entries
00094   * given by "count".
00095   * @param oct - pointer to the octeon device structure.
00096   * @return 0 if the allocation was successful, 1 otherwise.
00097   */
00098 int  octeon_init_pending_list(octeon_device_t  *oct);
00099 
00100 
00101 
00102 /** Free the pending list resources.
00103   *  @param octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device structure.
00104   */
00105 int  octeon_delete_pending_list(octeon_device_t    *octeon_dev);
00106 
00107 
00108 
00109 
00110 int
00111 wait_for_pending_requests(octeon_device_t   *oct);
00112 
00113 
00114 
00115 /** Adds a instruction waiting for response from octeon to the
00116   * pending list.
00117   * @param octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device structure.
00118   * @param  soft_instr  -  the instruction to add to pending list.
00119   * @return NULL if the instruction could not be added, else a 
00120   *         pointer to the entry in pending list is returned.
00121   */
00122 octeon_pending_entry_t *
00123 add_to_pending_list(octeon_device_t            *octeon_dev,
00124                     octeon_soft_instruction_t  *soft_instr);
00125 
00126 
00127 
00128 
00129 /**  Release an instruction from the pending list.
00130   *  @param octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device structure.
00131   *  @param pending_entry - the pending entry which holds the instr to be freed.
00132   */
00133 void  release_from_pending_list(octeon_device_t         *octeon_dev,
00134                                 octeon_pending_entry_t  *pending_entry);
